title: Using plus(+) sign with OFN and CSEmailMessage Parameter
author: Jorji Macatangay
content: Would be useful if we have a way to be able to include plus(+) sign in OFN and Email Body (CSEmailMessage) Parameters without it changing into a SPACE.  Using URLENCODE (%2B) but this does not work.

comments.content:
Hello Jorji, thank you for submitting this idea! The handling of special characters in button code is determined by Salesforce. Specifically, in the case of buttons, the plus symbol is used to represent spaces. Even when using the URLENCODE function, Salesforce converts a space into a plus symbol as part of its URL encoding process (source: https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.customize_functions_urlencode.htm&type=5)
Unfortunately, until an alternative method is provided for using plus symbols differently, we won’t be able to consider this change for future implementation.
Thank you for your understanding.

When using a Word doc composer solution, our users frequently experience an error with the text "The operation was canceled." We've isolated this issue to being 99% related to users having double quotes, custom formatting (bullet points, bolded text, etc. that has been copied and pasted from a word doc into a rich text field in Salesforce), or another illegal character in the rich text field. Once they correct this issue by either removing the double quotes or using the "Remove Formatting" button in the rich text field in Salesforce, the merge runs with no issue.
 
We've provided training and help bubbles for our users in Salesforce, but in the Conga Composer merge screen, they only see an error of "The operation was canceled." This leads to them starting a ticket with our support team stating that they are unable to run their merge successfully. The object record that they are running the merge from has dozens of fields, so they seem to forget the additional training they've had on using rich text fields.
 
If there was some sort of Conga internal work to check for this during the merge, and then display it to the user, that would be extremely helpful. Like "Error encountered with field_name, please correct."

title: Product Requirement for Automated Vendor Performance PDF Generation Integration with Conga

We are looking to enhance our existing vendor performance reporting system within Salesforce by automating the generation and attachment of a monthly PDF report to emails sent to our customers. This PDF report should be auto-generated based on the vendor's performance at the time, and it should include charts, graphs, and other visuals summarizing relevant data points. Automated PDF Generation: The solution should automatically generate a one-page PDF report on a monthly basis.
 
Dynamic Data: The PDF content should be populated with data specific to the vendor's performance for the respective customer account.
 
Visual Representation: The PDF should include charts, graphs, and other visuals to provide a clear and concise overview of vendor performance.
 
Seamless Integration: The solution should seamlessly integrate with our existing Salesforce configuration to minimize disruptions to our current workflow.
 
Email Attachment: The generated PDF report should be automatically attached to the monthly vendor performance emails sent to customers.

Happy to provide more info !

Fabien

content:

Operations would like shipments to be as cost effective as possible, this means warehouse staff needs to pick and ship inventory in the least amount of boxes as possible based on weight, dimensions and quantities sold on order lines. In order to do so, they will need a pick list printed for picking as well as a pack slip in the boxes before shipment is out the door.

Use Case 2: Consolidated invoicing, similar to above, difference is a finance user is able to print out many invoice lines that are from multiple invoices belonging to the same customer or purchase order number.

Solution: Allowing Composer to query child records based on the following logic (not a SOQL query)

SELECT ProductName, Quantity, Weight, Dimension, Price

FROM OrderLines

WHERE ParentOrderIdentifier IN (QVar Result Set)

Idea: Allow Qvar to store multiple identifiers to be used in another query's WHERE clause with IN. Based on numerous past test, current product capability does not allow that to happen, it gets very close though, the delimitator usually comes out wrong.

Simple Description:

In Lightning interface, End User creates a filtered List View in a custom object to return a list of results. Then while viewing the list of results records, End User *randomly* selects a subset of records from the full list by clicking on checkboxes of records. Then when End User has selected the random records desired from the list, they click a report generation button on the list view/object to output the record dataset to a *single* combined report.

One of the Business Examples:

End User needs to search for sales or lease comparables by market, price, SF, etc using List View on custom Comparables object. Then when the list of 25-100 records fitting filter criteria is returned, End User will manually review the list to select 3-5 of what they feel are the best records to use for a client facing comparable report. The 3-5 selected records are output into a single report to be presented to the client.

Current:

Client is using Conga Composer and Grid. Original request was to be able to select and output the records from Grid view. We also discussed using List View as alternative. Conga has given mixed feedback on requiring the use of Batch to output random selected records into a single or multiple reports from Grid or Lightning List View. Pricing was quoted at $6k plus transaction fees for Batch. Cost and Use Case does not justify full use or cost benefit of typical Batch solution—based on client feedback. CBRE is now asking about seeking alternative solutions including reviewing S-Docs to see if they can provide the functionality with their native solution.
